abstract: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug Truvada can prevent people from being infected by HIV, but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug and how it would affect other preventive measures.
snippet: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug can prevent people from being infected by H.I.V., but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug.
lead_paragraph: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug can prevent people from being infected by H.I.V., but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug.

headline.main: Questions on Tactic to Prevent H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: H.I.V. Drug Faces Trial And Raises Questions
headline.seo: Questions Surround Effort to Prevent H.I.V. With Antiretroviral Drugs
